comment: Very very old school, I spent $40 on printing just for her class. She requires everyone prints books worth of stuff for each project. Shes very sweet and wants you to succeed. She accepts late work and attendance isnt mandatory but you get points if you come. One of the tests took me 3 hours to complete, very long but if you study not terribly hard
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects

comment: RUN!!! The worst professor ever. She reads straight from slides and complains the entire class about how nobody is engaged. Weekly quizzes and weekly lab homeworks. Way too many research papers for an undergrad class. Exams have 80+ questions and its not all multiple choice. VERY HARD. I am shocked to finish this class with a B
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Marek is very sweet and is willing to go above and beyond for her students to learn the material. Her class is the most difficult class I have ever taken in the history of undergrad. She gives entirely too many writing assignments throughout the year and she gives 3-PART TESTS!!! They aren't that bad but it's too much.
Dr. marek is truly a character. She is so nice and really cares that her students understand the material. The class can definitely be a little dry sometimes but she's a good teacher.

Run the other way! She doesnt actually teach just reads from PowerPoint slides the whole 3 hour class. Puts in the least amount of effort possible and goes out of her way to not put in any work to explain concepts !!

If youre into old fashioned teaching then Dr. Marek is for you. Be prepared to teach yourself. Her grading is tough but she does except late work so thats good. The class is ok its just her teaching style needs to be updated
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: I love Dr. Marek as a person but as a prof not so much. Super long powerpoints which is all you do in class, tons of work, tests are hard and long, massive paper that you have to conduct your own research for, and she is very confusing when she teaches. The only reason I got a B was because of the TA. If you are not good at APA/stat DO NOT TAKE HER
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dr. Marek is great! Attendance isn't mandatory, but go to class because there are activities that really help for the tests. She gives the clearest directions for assignments of any professor I've ever had. She makes the assignments easy to do, you just have to do the work! The class seems challenging, but isn't if you apply yourself. Great teacher
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Material is difficult but Dr. Marek really does try to help everyone understand it. She gives alot of work but it helps you in the end. 10-12 question quizzes, 3 tests, SPSS labs, class project includes a paper. Attendance points,  Buy the textbook, follow her grading criteria to the T, and show up and you will get A or B. Take the class seriously!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Marek is the best!  I've taken 2 courses that she teaches and I just registered for my third course.  She is a great instructor.  She is not difficult and she doesn't try to trick you.  She really wants students to learn.  So, she gives detailed feedback and really works with you.  I love her and I would recommend her courses to anyone.
Got a B in this class. Read and study powerpoints you will pass with no problem

DR. Marek was awesome!! There is no way you can become confused. She provides extra credit and she allows you to make up assignments. She even takes them late with no points deducted (depending on how late). Very Understanding! Loved Her! Keep up with the assignments and study and you have an A! Go to class!

Dr. Marek is one of the best professors in the PSYC department. She actually cares about students, this does not mean she is easy! Her work is doable, but you will have to devote time to her class. Read the book & PowerPoint. Do her objectives as a SG & you should pass. There are quite a few assignments, but they are to offset the test grades.
She makes this class a bit more difficult than necessary. But passable if you're willing to devote a ton of time to it
YOU HAVE TO READ THE BOOK. YOU HAVE TO GO TO HER CLASS EVERYSINGLE TIME!!!!! HER TEST ARE HARD, YOU HAVE HW & CLASS PARTICIPATION EVERY WED.  SHE IS NOT THAT BAD

Marek is a great teacher! She really cares about her students. She's not easy, but she is extremely helpful. There is a lot of work. This is extremely helpful if you're not a good test taker. Attendance is not mandatory, but she does do class participation that cannot be made up. She's also known to give out extra points.

I loved this class and Dr. Marek! She inspired me to work hard, and I ended up with a really high A. Do the work, ALL the extra credit, READ the book, read the PPTs, and come to class so you don't miss participation points. Very interesting class overall with a really passionate professor. I would take Dr. Marek anytime!

Dr. Marek really knows her stuff.  Never a dull moment.  I have to agree with others, if you do your part, making sure to go to class and FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS SHE GIVES YOU, you can make the grade while learning something worthwhile!!

Incredible professor! Clear, helpful, provides plenty of points. Show up to class for participation points, extra credit opportunities. Never got the book, but got an A based on powerpoints and classes. Book would've been helpful, though. Funny, engaging, cares about her students. You MUST write at a college level to do well!!! Grammar counts!

Dr.Marek is a rare gem in this department and overall at KSU. She really cared about her students and wants you to actually take something useful away from the class. If you want to succeed take her for research methods. She's super consistent I'm taking experimental &cognitive with her and I'm sure I'll feel the same way after that class as well.

Dr. Marek is kind of zany, but it makes her fun. She does give A LOT of extra work, but it helps your grade. READ THE BOOK, DO THE BOOK QUIZZES, and USE THE COMPANION SITE. She takes questions straight from all of these and student review questions. She is SUPER helpful if you're struggling. It's a tough class, but definitely worth taking with her.

Dr. Marek was an awesome professor!!! Her tests and quizzes were kind of hard, but if you study it's no problem. A lot of homework, but it's all pretty easy and helps raise your grade. She is very helpful, and only wants to see her students succeed.  Really sweet and funny, just go to class and do the reading, and you'll get at least an a or b!

I don't know if the other raters were wanting a robot or what but Dr.Marek was an amazing instructor. She was the nicest professor I have had yet and she really knows her stuff. She also keeps things interesting and gives relevant examples so you can learn easier and remember longer. GREAT professor. Definitely recommend! I'm dropping Rogers 4 her.

STAY AWAY if you are not a PSYC major!  This was not a freshman level course.  I worked extremely hard and still got a C. The tests were extremely, I repeat extremely difficult and not enough time to complete them. I ended up with a 79 after 2 papers, a bunch of quizzes, and 3 exams. If you already know psychology, you would be fine.

Here is the scoop. YES-she is all over the place. YES-your graded assignments stink of smoke. YES-she gives a ton of work. YES-attendance is essential. YES-she is the APA Nazi. YES-her tests AND quizzes are hard-quiz EVERY MONDAY. BUT-I got a C or LOWER on all of her tests and still got a B in the class. Lots of ways to get the grade.

Research Methods is a hard class. This teacher makes it understandable. Best to take statistics before this class. The teacher is more than fair with xtra credit and make ups. She will work with you, but you must work with her(i.e show up,participate,do assignments). There is alot of work, but it is needed and will help you get a B or A.

This teacher is hard and make you learn, but wonderful.  I'm not the best student so I need some guidance here and there.  She is definately in the right career, as she cares and takes time with students.  Stay on top of your work and you will be fine, and pay attention to details and sentence structure.

I really liked this teacher very much. I thought she was more than fair in her grading, just watch your sentence structures on lab reports will lose many points just for english writing errors, her pet peeve. Use the Psy lab to check over your reports or papers before handing them in, otherwise a great teaher i learned much from her.

Love love love LOVED her!!! She is more than willing to help you out on any assignment you need help with, just don't wait til the last minute! She made an intimidating class seem more comprehensible and less scary. Yes there is a lot of work, but it's a good way to bring your grade up. Very sweet and funny, just read and study!!

I took the summer online class and it was  a breeze. She kept it very interesting with videos in addition to the reading. Weekly graded discussions and quizzes keep you on track for tests and give you leeway with your grade. Would love to take again!
Friendly, but she can be hard to understand. She's all over the place.

She is not this greatest person.This professor is rude and is not clear on her assignments. PLEASE keep up with you grades because she messed up alot. Everything she returns smells like smoke.....not to professional.  BE CAUTIOUS!!

Wonderful teacher!Her class is boing, but she makes sure the entire class have an understanding.Each exam has 100 questions, which is a good thing~& she gives you candy during the test.She gives alot of work but in return it helps maintain a A or bring up your grade.She gives extra credit.She has a BIG heart & wants everyone to pass.Just Read text

READ everything available and attend every class. Prof is very intelligent but confusing as a teacher; has a hard time staying focused. Loads you down with homework, quizes,reading,and class participation. Exams are hard.

She hard to understand sometimes.I took this class during the Summer 4 week session & I would not recommend taking it like that because of ALL the reading you have to do. There's ALOT of information and 4 weeks is not enough time.She quizzed us like every 2 days and had a exam right after that.  It was horrible!!!  Overall she's nice & fair.
